resources.string: This office exists to bridge the gap between financial constraints and your yearning for knowledge. We believe that everyone deserves a chance to unlock their full potential, regardless of their financial background.

string.name: contact_address
string.u: University of Sindh, Allama I.I. Kazi Campus, Jamshoro - 76080, Sindh, Pakistan

resources.string:
The Ehsaas scholarship is an exciting program that aims help students who are facing financial difficulties.

It is a paradigm shift in a policy of the Government of Pakistan to support undergraduate level students who after completing FA/FSc./Intermediate are unable to pursue university education due to limited financial resources.

The scholarship covers university tuition fee and stipend throughout four-five years of degree duration.

The project aims to support female education therefore 50% of scholarships are reserved for the female students.

To encourage physically challenged students, 2% of the scholarships are reserved for them.

It foresees to create drive for education among those students who have discontinued studies due to limited financial issues.

Student Card\n
Marksheet of Previous Semester\n

Duly Filled Application Form

The Government of Pakistan acknowledges these constraints and has tasked Higher Education Commission to facilitate the needy and deserving students through Need Based Scholarships. Scholarships have been announced for financially disadvantaged students of as many as 100 public sector universities and their campuses.

Need-cum- Merit Based Scholarship opportunity is available for talented and financially disadvantaged students of Bachelors and Masters Regular Programs.\n\nNeed-Cum-Merit Based Scholarship provides an opportunity to deserving students, enabling them with desired competence and skills in public sector leading HEIs, as per the need of industry to play a vital role in the development and literacy of Pakistan.

National Endowment Scholarships for Talent (NEST) provides need based scholarship to talented students in different fields of study. It is a self-sustainable program that invests in education by providing financial support to talented students and help them stand on their feet. NEST plans to achieve the target of providing 2000 scholarships every year to the talented but deserving students.

The Sindh Educational Endowment Fund (SEEF) was created in 2002–03. It is managed through Trust called Sindh Education Endowment fund Trust. It aims to provide financial assistance to the students hailing from low income groups to acquire higher education from reputable public / private sector universities. 

It was created by College Education Department, Government of Sindh to provide financial assistance for higher quality education to the most talented and needy students of Sindh has created Sindh Educational Endowment Fund(SEEF).Education is one of the most powerful instrument for reducing poverty and inequality. It also sets the foundation for sustainable economic growth of Sindh and Pakistan as well.

It aims to provide support and assistance to impart education and award scholarship to the deserving and needy students of the Province of Sindh to enable them to complete their Graduate and Post-Graduate education in the field of Information Technology, Engineering, Medicine and Business Administration.

The objective of minorities scholarship is Empowerment of Minority communities, groups, and individuals through their active participation in development programs for improved social functioning and quality of life.

Development and implementation of integrated safety net programs for Minority Communities that address social risks which are the result of unemployment, retirement, illness/disability, old age, and death.

Organizational transformation and development for effective management, communication, planning, financial management, reporting and utilization of resources for the betterment of Minorities in Sindh.

The University admits a large number of students, majority belonging to rural areas and disadvantaged poor families, realizing that education has become very costly and it is difficult for them to pursue their education due to financial constraints. The University has taken initiative for providing financial relief to meritorious and deprived students with the financial assistances/need based scholarship programs. In this regard, the District Merit Scholarship is one of many programs which the University of Sindh has started to empower and assist the students financially.

The Punjab Educational Endowment Fund (PEEF) is a proactive scholarhsip scheme which provides scholarships at the doorstep of talented students of Punjab, Sindh, AJK, FATA, Gilgit Baltistan and ICT. The mission of PEEF is to build a critical mass of human capital, belonging to less priviledged areas of Punjab, participating in nation building; through the provision of equitable opportunities to the academically brilliant girls and boys.\n\nThere are more than 455,000 such success stories in Pakistan just because of the Scholarship program launched by Government of Punjab in 2009.

The Pakistan Scottish Scholarship for Young Women and Girls funds graduate studies for Pakistani women in any HEC recognized university across Pakistan. Funded by the Scottish Government, these grants aim to make higher education more accessible to women, supporting them in achieving their potential and ambition.

Scotland Pakistan Scholarships for Young Women and Girls is being offered at undergraduate level for a four-year’s bachelor’s degree as well.

British Council will administer the scheme in Pakistan and coordinate with selected scholars and universities either directly or through nominated university focal persons.

Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal (PBM), an autonomous body set up through 1991 Act. PBM is significantly contributing toward poverty alleviation through its various poorest of the poor focused services and providing assistance to destitute, widow, orphan, invalid, infirm & other needy persons, as per eligibly criteria approved by Bait-ul-Mal Board.\n\nFollowing the vision of the Prime Minister to revolutionize the social services, we have undertaken the responsibility to yield the most effective and positive social change in the country through organizational efforts. By helping abandoned people and their families, PBM is moving on investing that could help trigger a long-term reallocation of capital, talent and other resources for the country which might leave the biggest positive impact on future of Pakistan.

Diya is a lamp (in Urdu), a symbol of light and thereby Hope. In Pakistan, a large portion of the population does not have access to proper education. Diya Pakistan is a professionally managed charitable organization that is committed to eradicating poverty by promoting literacy.\n\nSince 1988, Diya has reached out to talented, financially distressed students with more than 600,000+ merit scholarships valued at more than US$ 10.5+ million, enabling them to continue their education. The impact is eye-opening.
This financial assistance is provided to the schedule caste students (minority students) on the Poverty-Cum Merit basis to the needy and deserving students for bachelor degree programme.

Sindh is province where young, talented and smart youth is in abundance but in many cases, a lack of resources stops them from reaching their full potential. This becomes increasingly difficult when it comes to gaining entrance to higher education. Sindh Government acknowledges this fact well and has entrusted Sindh Higher Education Commission with a task to assist meritorious and deserving students from both Public and Private Sector Universities through its Scholarships Programme.

A Memorandum of Understanding has been signed between the University of Sindh and Professor Amena Khamisani Education Assistance under which scholarships will be provided to the female students of the Institute of English Language and Literature consecutively for 3 years.\n\nThis scholarship pays for full admission fees, library fees, tuition, hostel accommodation, PLUS a stipend of Rs 7500 per month till graduation subject to satisfactory academic performance.
